cs.SE, cs.CR, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the problem of synthesizing a property-preserving platform mapping, which involves decisions about how a high-level design is to be implemented using primitives from a low-level platform. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category, which deals with the design, development, and maintenance of software systems. 

The paper also mentions the need to preserve a desired property from a high-level design into a low-level platform implementation, which suggests that it may be relevant to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category, which deals with the design and analysis of secure systems. 

The paper proposes a technique for synthesizing a mapping based on symbolic constraint search, which suggests that it may be relevant to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-category, which deals with the design and implementation of programming languages and their compilers. 

The paper also provides a formalization of the synthesis problem, which suggests that it may be relevant to the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) sub-category, which deals with the use of logic and formal methods in computer science. 

Finally, the paper describes a case study demonstrating the application of the technique to synthesizing secure platform mappings for OAuth, a popular family of authorization protocols on the web, which suggests that it may be relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category, which deals with the design
